page.title: 06Willesborough Schools
page.content: After their fifth birthday the local children attend the Infants School situated in Church Road. There they begin to learn about letters and numbers and their uses. After they are seven they will move onto the Junior School. At present this has two sites, one in Highfield Road and the other in Lees Road. The school contains about 500 children. By the age of 11 they should be able to read, calculate and communicate fluently. Most children then go to the Ashford Boys or the Ashford Girls Secondary Schools. At 13 it can be possible, through testing to transfer to a higher ability school. Children can leave at 16 to find a job or stay to complete their studies by the age of 18. Some would then move onto college or university.
